p: The major component of citrus essential oil (CEO) in citrus waste is d-limonene, which makes up 68–98% of sweet orange essential oil [ 5]. Several studies have shown the inhibition effect of d-limonene on anaerobic digestion of citrus waste. Mizuki et al. [ 6] reported that the limit dosage of d-limonene was 26 mg/(L·day). Wikandari et al. [ 7] reported that the methane production of single-stage anaerobic digestion halted at an organic loading rate (OLR) of 1.5 g VS/(L·day). Their study showed that VFA (volatile fatty acids) started to be accumulated around 7.5 g/L, which indicated that the inhibition occurred in the system at this OLR.
